Key Match Events: Colombia opened the scoring in the 8th minute through Jhon Cordoba
James Rodriguez doubled their lead in the 15th minute from the penalty spot
Luis Diaz added a third just before halftime
Richard Rios scored a fourth in the 71st minute
Miguel Borja scored a fifth in the 92nd minute from the penalty spot
Post-Match Reflections: James Rodriguez put on a passing clinic, was an ace from dead ball set-piece attempts and captained his country to their 27th-straight match unbeaten
Panama conceded inside the opening 10 minutes and then again in the next five minutes
Panama's defense had a poor performance, especially in the opening 15 minutes
Colombia will advance to play the winner of Brazil-Uruguay in the semifinals of the tournament Wednesday night
Miscellaneous Highlights: Colombia have the longest unbeaten streak in global men's soccer in the international game at the moment
Defeating Panama moved their incredible record to 27 straight matches without a defeat
Their last loss arrived in February 2022, at the hands of Lionel Messi and Argentina
